description.narrative: The project "Beware of the dangers of Gambling" of GASK's includes Awareness raising, Prevention and Protection. 1. Awareness of Dangers of gambling and the role it plays in poverty, capital flight, money laundering and corruption in Africa. 2. Prevention of gambling addiction and harm through education of the public. 3. Protection of vulnerable persons from gambling through advocacy and lobbying to curb underage gambling. Gambling in Kenya traditionally included activities such as wagering at casinos, card games and games of personal skill for example pool and video games. However with the emergence of online-gambling/internet-betting over the past years, gambling has been growing exponentially, is heavily marketed and successfully targets the youths. A recently-released Kenya Media Landscape report by Reelforge and TIFA Research found that betting companies had been the top advertisers in the country in 2017 and 2018, spending over Sh20 billion a year. Sportpesa, Betin and 1XBet featured among the most visited websites by Kenyans. In 2016 a campus-wide survey we carried out to gauge the extent of gambling prevalence among students, nearly half of all respondents admitted to one or more signs of problem gambling behaviour. These findings indicate the need for interventions to raise awareness of the risks associated with sports betting and to temper emerging social norms that betting is an integral and harmless part of sport watching and a way to make money. Given the recent and expected future growth in gambling industry, consumer protection, public awareness and education ,which we intend to carry out, are of utmost importance if harms associated with gambling are to be minimize

participating-org.narrative: The Gaming Awareness Society of Kenya (GASK) was founded in 2015 by Nelson Bwire as anti-gambling campaign initiative in Kenyatta University. After successfully submitting to the government the report of a survey he carried out to gauge gambling participation, behaviours and problems among young people, he took the initiative to social media platforms to reach population beyond the university. He registered it as a society in 2019 when he teamed up with like minded people with the aim of educating the public to protect them from being harmed or exploited by gambling . We currently have 20 active members. In our existence, most notable achievements are: • In 2016, We carried out the first gambling awareness event in the University and country to sensitize students on dangers of gambling. • In 2017, We lead to closing down of a rogue online gaming company that was fleecing its users by presenting complaints and facts to the gaming board. • In 2019, we presented before Kenyan parliament a raft of prevention and protection measures to curb gambling addiction.
